content.description: A beautiful, long route with a short, friendly crux that's well protected. Endurance is not the game on this one, despite its length, due to the many large ledges. Some route finding skills can be good at times.
content.location: The long route to the right of Machete.

climbs.name: Virgin Bolter Tag Team
climbs.fa: Jared Hancock, Mike Hatchett, Mark Ryan, Skip Wolfe, 2005

content.description: Begin by pulling past the obvious roof. Rock and route quality drop after these opening moves.
content.location: This is the farthest left of three bolted lines on the face to the left of Kokopeli's Dream. It begins with the obvious roof.

content.description: Ascend the obvious chimney between the left side of the pinnacle and the main wall. Climb up through the cave and spiral around to a ledge near the top at the right side of the pinnacle. Fun.
content.protection: Standard RRG rack. Dedicated 2 bolt anchor with 1 ring on a metal cable

content.description: Super steep route that continues out of the rock house above the pinnacle.  Fun and exposed with a few powerful moves.
Super fun route. Hard moves up the overhanging start then it gets hard up high.
content.location: Right around the corner from Kokopeli's Dream.  Starts on a small ledge along with two other lines; Suppress the Rage is the furthest left of the three.

climbs.name: Some Humans Ain't Human
climbs.fa: Rob Copeland, Jared Hancock, James Case, 2005

content.description: Much better than its neighbor Gringo.  Start near the same ledge as Gringo on the far right side of the wall.  A steep section leads a good rest and the first bolt.  Make the big difficult move off the first bolt.  Followed by a few more balancy technical moves.  Trend back left slightly to the anchors.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a two bolt anchor.  Rap with a 60m rope.
content.location: At the far right side of the wall next to a big flat boulder.

content.description: Located to the right of Continental. Slightly overhanging somewhat flaring finger to handcrack. Bouldery start. Follow until crack stops then climb past chicken heads to anchors. somewhat sandbagged, rrg.com consensus rating between 5.10b/c.
content.protection: .5-1 cams; sling chicken heads on the way to fixed anchors strongly advised to protect against a ground fall

content.description:
Begin with a sustained pocketed face up about 40 feet to an excellent rest. Shake out and study the crux right above you, and when you're ready, pull the final roof to a large ledge with the anchors.

Major style points if you actually mantle the last move instead of flopping onto your stomach.
content.protection: 7 or so bolts, bolted anchor. Reaching the anchor from the ledge could be a challenge for shorter climbers.
content.location: This is the middle of the three bolted routes to the left of Kokopeli's Dream.

content.description: Crux is getting off the ground. A nice pitch on a face with holds on the arete to the left.
content.protection: 4 bolts and a two bolt anchor to lower off of

content.description: Pockety face with good clips vearing left to the anchors. Great for a first time leader
content.location:
Shares the first 2 bolts with

Machete

off to the left of Kokopeli's Dream

content.description: Start on the ledge and climb up the steep arete with fun moves to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: This is one of the first routes encounter after the approach.  It is the second route from the left side of the wall.

content.description: Hop up to first hold, follow a finger crack in a left-facing dihedral to a first small roof and continue up to a second wider roof. Plug in some big cams and move out and then up.
content.protection: Standard rack with larger cams for the obvious roof.
content.location: Left of rock shelter/cave/low arch that is left of Virgin Bolter Tag Team.

content.description: Overhanging finger and hand crack with a few bolts where there is no crack.
content.location: Mixed route left of "Fear or Common Sense".

climbs.name: Dingo the Gringo
climbs.fa: Jarod Hancock, Karla Carandang, Mark ryan Jenny Wagner, 2005

content.description:
This is a one-move wonder.  The crux is at the first bolt.  A stick clip is highly recommended due to the belay from a ledge and the move to get to the bolt.

Start up a short overhang to a flared crack.  Make a difficult move to get established in the crack.  Then enjoy very easy slabbing to the top.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a two bolt rap anchor.  Rap with a 60m rope.
content.location: This is at the far right side of the cliff.  The route starts on a small ledge.

content.description:
This is the compelling pocket line featuring the map of Africa, just as you reach the wall.  Listed as a TR in the RRG3 guide, but fully bolted and ready to go.

3rd clip (near Libya) is hard -- good feet and an alert belayer here.  5th clip is scary but very safe.  I went quite a ways R at that point, then traversed back in for the clip.

As of 11/10/11, the route was pretty scruffy above the 4th bolt.  If it were cleaned up a bit, I'd give it 3 stars instead of 2.
Scamper up on to the starting block and throw in your biggest piece as high as you can reach. Step off the block in to a couple chimney moves and jam or layback the rest of the short fist crack.
content.protection: Just a couple pieces are needed from hands on up. A #6 Camalot or Friend will relieve the initial fear of commitment to the chimney moves if you don't have the wingspan of an ape to place a #5. Finish at a bolted wire rope anchor up and right of the pinnacle.
content.location: Towards the right end of the crag is the pinnacle of Kokopeli's Dream. This route skirts up the wide crack on the right side between the pinnacle and the main wall.

content.description: Grip, Grab, and Grovel your way up the first few bolts, before mantling up to a slabby face. Continue on the easy terrain continue up the face above on surprisingly good black colored rock to a ledge and a mythical blackberry bush where one can enjoy the fruit of their labor.
content.location: 10 feet right on the start for Dingo the Gringo. Currently the right most route at Sunnyside.
